title: Customized VR-Based Mathematics Operation Experiential Learning Design for Special Education Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (operations, measurement, geometry, graph interpretation) and proficiency in using digital tools (web browsers, basic apps, VR interfaces)
context.additional_context: Providing customized experiential learning environments for special education learners based on cognitive style differences (visual/auditory/kinesthetic). Integrates multiple representations (graphic models, audio explanations, manipulatives) for mathematical concept understanding. Employs spatial reasoning and multimodal representation systems (symbols, diagrams, physical manipulation) in VR settings

learning_goals: Analyze cognitive styles of learners with special needs and design ≥3 types of customized VR-based math learning content focusing on basic operations (addition/subtraction/multiplication/division) and fractions/equations.

Develop ≥2 formative assessment tools to measure learner engagement and understanding of operational concepts (variable control, pattern recognition, graph interpretation) (e.g., real-time problem-solving tracking system, visual feedback rating scale).

Learners can implement a web-based experiential learning platform prototype compatible with BYOD environments within two weeks, meeting the following criteria: 1) ≥95% functional compatibility verified across Chrome, Safari, and Edge browsers; 2) responsive design for mobile/tablet/desktop (320px–1920px resolution); 3) ≥3 basic math operation modules (e.g., fraction learning via visual partitioning models, graphic-based equation solving using coordinate planes, drag-and-drop integer operations); 4) OAuth 2.0-based user authentication (login/logout) with successful security vulnerability testing.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
